9.author: mrbulldops428
9.body:
So I really don't know many specifics but look up: stable diffusion, DALL E, or midjourney. Those are the big ones I know of. Chatgpt is a like text AI thing, it's been in the news lately for college kids using it to cheat, as well as the fact that it can apparently pass board/bar/licensing exams. I dont know much aside from the fact that I hate when people post AI stuff and try to pass it off as real or something they painted lol

If your ever curious if something is AI look at the small details. On people it's the hands. In this image it's the way the bark blends into the branches, which themselves are in very regular patterns. Someone also mentioned the shadow being a giveaway.

9.author: Consistent-River4229

9.author: mrbulldops428
9.body: For sure. AI is helping a lot in medicine already,  with things like finding new treatments or new ways to diagnose things. Would be scary to learn your human surgeon cheated on their tests with an AI though lol

9.author: Consistent-River4229

17.author: BubbaChain100000
17.body: Not here to play semantics. We both agree that anything involving abuse to children is bad - we don’t need to rehash what any reasonable person would think.

17.author: yuxulu
17.body: Today's reasonable is very very different from reasonable a few hundred or thousands years ago. Like we treat sex as a private affair as a matter of course. But a lot of culture, including the chinese, which i am, used to treat it as a matter of duty or family survival. To them, watching ur adult children have sex to make sure they actually had sex is as natural as watching ur pot when u cook so u know it is boiling.

17.author: BubbaChain100000
17.body: No way. Any articles/sources about this?

17.author: yuxulu
17.body:
Bedding ceremony is a thing in 15th centry europe: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bedding_ceremony

Though it usually happens only on the night of wedding for people of higher standing as bloodline mattered. Sometimes, wedding is only legally accepted once bedding ceremony is performed by someone of high standing. A version of it was even in the game of thrones.

If u think about it, it is actually very logical. In a society where birth amd bloodline is really important, a matter of continuation of ur linage, wouldn't u want to make sure? Like what if a year later, the bride who is another noble's kid runaway and claim that the marriage is null and never consumated? 

Marriage by law is a relatively new concept. It used to be by blood or sex.

Edit: sorry, sent two replies that's meant to be one.

17.author: BubbaChain100000
17.body: The article stated that in most cases they didn’t actually watch them fuck

17.author: yuxulu
17.body:
You do realise that these spans hundred of years (1200-1920 according to the source below) and the  tradition transformed along the way as well too right? And by "most", let's say 500 out of the 700 hundred years, still left 200 where witnessing is required, the whole of american history. 

What i'm saying is that for potentially hundred of years, it is witnessed. It is hard to pin down where "most" started or ended. But it is a tradition and significant cultural change. In today's world, this is completely not acceptable. But back then it very much is for a long long time. We just don't know for how long, how common, how much is required viewing.

17.author: yuxulu
17.body:
This is the second reply, in case reddit mess this up.

r/AskHistorians has a very very good discussion on when privacy during sex become important in the western europe too. A bit of a rabbit hole but you can read more about this topic. Like I said, the transformation happened 1500 to 1600, in the middle of the source for the wiki article I linked.

[https://www.reddit.com/r/AskHistorians/comments/24uikm/when\_did\_people\_start\_having\_sex\_in\_private\_or\_is/](https://www.reddit.com/r/AskHistorians/comments/24uikm/when_did_people_start_having_sex_in_private_or_is/)

And again, it is very logical. Churches did allow marriage to be disavowed if it is unconsummated for a period. So at some point, the church probably want to make sure that marriage they approved did get consummated.

Secondly, most homes for poorer households did not have the capacity for privacy for a long time historically. While two have sex, every other member of the family are basically unwitting witnesses. So it would make sense that even when private rooms become common, some places will treat witnessing sex as tradition. This form of low privacy housing very much existed into the 18th and 19th century in the form of Icelandic Turf House [https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Icelandic\_turf\_house](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Icelandic_turf_house). Hard to have sex without everyone else seeing it here. But again, hard to definitively prove if people actually had sex in them while families are inevitably around (Icelandics might be hardcore celibate, who knows). Going further back into history, the viking long houses can have dozens living in them. Their sex life will definitely not be private and cultures have to adapt.

Unfortunately, neither of us will have definitive proof as traditions tend to be a patchwork. So you do see people in the same thread raising proof that the romans may have the concept of sexual privacy earlier (100-500AD). Then again, they usually describe sex as a "secret thing" rather than "private thing" if I'm not wrong. The poster also said that sex being private and it being public are not exactly conflicting as well.

Please keep this discussion civil. While I get we are discussing sex, but I'm not here to get swore at. Just some serious talk on a weird topic.

20.author: brian_heriot
20.body:
Ever seen the television series: ***Quantum Leap*** (not the 2022 version, but the oldie but goodie)?

It's insanely Pantheopsychic in its premise, in which Dr. Sam Beckett "leaps" into various periods within his lifetime to "possess" (for lack of a better term), random individuals in the past.  He would glance in a window or mirror and see himself in the form of an entirely different person, and ad lib his  reactions to and actions toward others who believed and acted toward him as if he were the original person, the consciousness of whom I suppose slumbered in his subconscious while he sits in the consciousness "driver's seat".

One of my favorite episodes was *The Colour of Truth* in which Sam, a white man, leaps into the body of an elderly black man in the ravages of the Jim Crow South.

The Pantheopsychic process of salvation, as spoiled above, is simply a matter of Christ, like Sam Beckett in the tv series, lapsing into an eon's long non-lucid dream while dreaming of dying upon the cross (a dream within a dream, as there is only George Berkeley's Idealism in existence) to assume the identities of every human that has ever existed (if Universalism is true) or only the identities of every human that shall be saved (if Annihilationism is true as Pantheopsychism denies the existence of eternally punishing Hell in lieu of obliterating the wicked from existence following biological death), believing He *was* each person and suffering every sin the person shall commit and every negative experience the person shall encounter, before "leaping" to dream of being the next person or next saved person, etc. etc.

"The foolishness of what was preached", indeed, but nevertheless a logically and metaphysically possible form of the actual nature of reality.

Jay M. Brewer

Pantheopsychic Philosopher

Austin, Texas

20.author: brian_heriot
20.body:
"God was pleased by the **foolishness of what was preached** *to save those who believe.*"

\-1 Corinthians 1:21

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Had to spill the beans and spoil the final page of **Pantheopsychic Comics #3: WHAT MUST I BE TO BE SAVED? Part One**

PC #3 is in two parts: the first revealing how one has one's name written in the Book of Life according to common, everyday Fundamentalist Christianity (which is finished and in the process of illustration as we speak) and Part Two revealing the **universe-shaking revelation of HOW ONE HAS ONE'S NAME WRITTEN IN THE BOOK OF LIFE AND IS THUS RENDERED INELIGIBLE FOR OR IMMUNE TO HELL ACCORDING TO PANTHEOPSYCHIC THEOLOGY...SPELLED OUT PLAIN AS DAY IN THE ABOVE ILLUSTRATION!**

So there it is, naked out of the shower...though Part Two will elaborate this bizarre, inextricable *shared fate* between Christ and certain humans in cosmic detail for intellectual completeness.

Jay M. Brewer

Pantheopsychic Philosopher

Austin, Texas

20.author: brian_heriot
20.body: A proposition of a logically infallible Christianity, actually.

28.author: TrxshBxgs
28.body:
I'm open to many beliefs, especially if one of them were to put forth evidence. I'm an agnostic, not an atheist. I think the disconnect between us is you're assuming that I think I know absolute truths about anything, and I don't. I believe that the Christian church is full of shit though, and I can show with evidence that it does harm. thus my and many others adoption of "negative" Christian iconography as a way to combat rampant theism having a direct impact on secular lives. I'd have no need for or involvement with baphomet if I didn't have to see government installations of Christian iconography, and he wouldn't be a mascot to so many if human rights weren't under attack by religious politicians and citizens.

If I'm wrong and it's all real, then I hitched my cart to the idea of knowledge seeking, free will/bodily autonomy, and rebellion against absolute authority and I can live with that.

28.author: Antisocialite99
28.body:
Well they can be arrogant but it's not their faith itself that's arrogant. 

Just like I said I'm agnostic based on humility doesn't mean I can't also think I'm smarter than everyone I meet etc etc. 

Faith itself is not an act of arrogance.

28.author: Antisocialite99
28.body:
An actual agnostic operates from the perspective of humility that we lack the frame of reference to know what happens after we die and if we have a soul. 

You're operating from the basis of arrogance and some sort of antagonism towards belief. 

You can still hitch your cart to knowledge seeking etc without the arrogance. You're not an agnostic You're just contrarian to theism. Knowledge seeking is humility not arrogance

28.author: TrxshBxgs
28.body: My indignation stems from the perceived right of theists to impose their will on the populace. Are you not upset at the overturning of Roe v Wade? And those same religious folks are poised and ready to strike down more human rights, or at least the legal protections for those rights. Youre correct in saying im a contrarian and an antagonist to religion, but i dont feel this way about theism unless your conversations with your god end with a decree to tread on others. Its not arrogance, it's vitriol at the overreach of what is quickly becoming a minority group in the USA imposing their views on everyone with political and legal support.

32.author: Vainpaix
32.body:
It's kind alien to a native-speaker as well as just this song contains lots of period-words no-one would use today, and there's error in the grammer just for the sake of rhymining. 

The whole thing is a big joke - *Trazan* is obviously a riff on *Tarzan*, but it's also a self-referrential pun, as the Swedish word for a rag is *trasa*, and the kind of pants he's wearing are the type stereotypically fixed with bits and pieces of random fabrics, i.e rags. *Apansson* meanwhile is *Monkeyson*, as in *Monkey's son*. Despite his name, he's just a dude in "monkey print"-pants who's a *bit off*.

*Banarne* is a fusion of *banan* (banana) and *Arne*. He's an actual monkey.

35.author: wantonTOSviolator
35.body:
The menu is from a restaurant I visited many times while living in Yiwu, China during 2015. The food was a combination of Chinese, Middle Eastern, and Thai (they had a Thai cook on staff who later left). The co-owner was from Egypt. It was actually a wonderful place to eat. 

But... if the heading "This for Money" doesn't seem a bit weird to you, then I don't know what to say but THAT'S weird in and of itself.

35.author: midoxvx
35.body: It isn’t weird to me cuz this is obviously bad google translate job, probably they were trying to say prices or priced items. To me this is normal cuz I have seen far worse n hilarious variations of menus all over the mid east when I worked there.

35.author: wantonTOSviolator
35.body:
Okie dokie, to each their own. 

(Seriously though, Seinfeld could have easily based an entire episode off of this menu alone...)

35.author: midoxvx
35.body: Gonna ask the real questions now: did you like the food items on the right side of the menu? Beans and Falafel are *chef’s kiss* in my opinion.

35.author: wantonTOSviolator
35.body: What knocked my socks off was a clay pot dish of braised / baked oxtails in onion and tomato with spices called "Aqkawi" (If memory serves). Their Thai food was excellent...until the Thai cook left. They also had a very good lamb kabobs. Oh, and the Chinese dishes were also very good IF the Chinese cook was in a good mood.

35.author: midoxvx
35.body:
Holy shit, I am Egyptian by origin, I can’t tell you how happy I am to read “Akawi” right now and you are absolutely right, that dish is out of this world. Whenever I visit home its always one of my first requests.

Have you had any chance to try stuffed pigeons? — I know how it sounds but it’s an Egyptian delicacy and we don’t eat regular pigeons you see flying around, they are special farmed breed. If you ever get a chance to try them, give them a go, you won’t regret it.

35.author: wantonTOSviolator
35.body:
I thought about trying to make Akawi myself, as my wife bought something similar to the clay pot they made it in. Have yet to try though. Now it sounds like something I must do!  
Never had Egyptian-style pigeon before, but I've had a few different Chinese versions in Beijing and Tianjin. Very good, actually!

39.author: pharmdocmark
39.body: Damned right. LA area in 91-93, was some craaaazy Underground parties - before they became known as Raves. Yep. Gigantic circus tents and a few thousand people from about 8pm-7am. Wow.

39.author: Ok_Actuator_5091
39.body: I was up in the Bay Area but did travel South to LA parties and North to Seattle parties till I moved to Seattle in 94. But from late 90 on was just amazing. I feel lucky to have gotten to experience that.

39.author: pharmdocmark
39.body:
Man, I’m from Virginia. Joined the Navy, was stationed in Long Beach, so south LA County right…so from ‘90-‘94 I saw the craziest gawdam parties, things I never would have experienced back in the south. A whole different breed of people, way of thinking and so on. 
I never did any of the ex one could find as easy as bottled water at those things. Seems crazy in retrospect, but I never did. I just danced around all night, met some incredible people, became a fan of Lords of Acid, and never had to sweat a drug screen.
Magical days, the 90’s.

39.author: Ok_Actuator_5091
39.body: Ha! The Lord's of Acid were one of the fantastic Industrial/Rave crossover bands. I say My Life With The Thrill Kill Kult and Lord's of Acid together with Traci Lord's spinning after. Their latest album from last year called Beyond Booze is a fun ride. But ai think the craziest thing/trip/vibe party I went to was The TOPY/Psychic TV show in S. F. That whole show was like a crazy pulsing trip led by Genesis P-Orridge. That was one crazy party.

39.author: pharmdocmark
39.body:
I can only imagine. 
There was this one underground in late 92 around Halloween, and it was some big ass abandoned warehouse, way the fawk up north of Hollywood. Some place I could never find twice. Of course. Cast members of 90210 showed up, Drew Barrymore was there (I talked to her for an hour at 3am, score! Lol), they had Nitzerebb and some other up and coming Rave/Industrial outfits perform. 
Man, the days of our 20’s. Fuck I miss em.

The dude who wrote the mythology, L. Ron Hubbard, said that a suppressive person is like a junk human being, who is worse than Hitler. Current Scientologists are not allowed to talk to suppressive persons. I find just saying I am one makes them go away, and respects their religious boundaries. 

They have agents who’ve slunk around our community, and are just the most stressed out people in a sad state, but 100% devoted to their delusion.

That's very interesting though. So you used to be a scientologist? Or did I misunderstand there? How long were you with them for. That had to be some ride

43.author: mmmyesplease---
43.body:
Oh no, I’m secular. I’ve come across their community through victims of spiritual abuse through our offices work. Well, long story short, just flabbergasted this “religion” is allowed to work out in the open. Like, Scientology is responsible for the largest breech of the American Government, in the late 70’s. Then the US government gave them tax exemption status in in the early 90’s with no sign of changes illicit behaviors? And it just doesn’t stop with espionage: rape, forced abortions, murder, negligence, money, laundering, suicide, child abuse, smuggling, suppression of victims, torture, religious offices in Pakistan in Columbia…yea. It’s like the Legion of Doom’s religious branch. 

It’s just so infuriating that the cult is operating with the coerced consent of the US government, and the US taxpayers are having to put a bill for an illicit business. And anytime opposition  tries to bring up human rights violations, everybody is like, “bUt MaVeRiCk Is AwEsOmE”

Sorry, I will get off my soap box now. Coffee sounds great.

Scientology isn’t the big cult out here, but they share enough similarities when the one that is, I’ve met a few survivors, but not treated.

43.author: mmmyesplease---

If you would like to know more about Scientology, Leah Remini, who was a devout Scientologist, has a show [*Scientology and the Aftermath.*](https://www.aetv.com/shows/leah-remini-scientology-and-the-aftermath) The show gives a great overview of the cup from beginning to today. She also has a [podcast](https://fairgamepodcast.com) that is also great information.

I guess it's tough to find exactly where the line between cult and fringe religion is

47.body:
Nothing about that post implies the poster is an "Epstein Fanboy".

Also, the man owned a private island filled with underage girls and his plane was known as the Lolita Express. The idea that he was not trading sex with these women for money and favors is delusional. The fact that he did it was an open secret on par with Weinstein's abuses.

If anything, *you're* more of an Epstein fanboy than me or the person you linked, because you're the one de facto defending him by claiming he didn't do the thing that everyone fucking knows he did.

47.body:
lol, you’re the one who can’t figure he was the one fucking kids, so ironic you’d say that. Straight projection. I’ve been saying he was the John the whole time, you’re claiming he was selling them to other guys, which you have no evidence of. And saying he was murdered? Because he was going to sell out the other rich elites? And I’m the one martyring him? 

In your world Epstein was a victim and the government is the bad guy. Not trying to strawman you and say you don’t think he wasn’t doing heinous things, but you said yourself you’d rather live in prison the rest of your life than die, so you do think him somewhat a victim. Know what, you’re a moron. I’m done because there’s no reasoning with someone this delusional.

47.author: estrusflask
47.body:
He was not *the only one* fucking kids. People do not call your fucking airliner that they all want to fly on The Lolita Express if they do not expect to get to fuck the kids themselves.

Also, I never said Epstein was murdered. In fact, I said that it doesn't matter whether he was murdered or not, because the reason people meme about it is because of the extremely well known fact that he was highly connected and procured sex slaves that other powerful men could fuck.

Delusional is pretending that the man known for having an island where you could go to fuck tweens was the only one having sex with those girls and his friends just came to the island for mini golf.

47.author: Fit-Sheepherder-4013
47.body: lol, I’m pretty sure the girls went with him wherever he went. They weren’t running around like wild cattle on an island dum dum. And the FBI investigated it and Maxwell went to court over it. I’m not sure who else was arrested but there’s no evidence of Tom Hanks or Bill Gates or whatever particular boogeyman of your political liking doing anything illegal.

47.author: estrusflask

The reason people like this story, or the Clinton emails or the Hunter laptop is because anything is in the emails or on the laptop that you choose to believe. You can’t prove it’s there but nobody can prove it’s not. Same with the Epstein case. Simultaneously everyone was doing it and everybody knows about it but for some reason there’s no witnesses, no accusations and no evidence to support it. 49.author: Peaches-n-macaroons
49.body: It's easy to discount it. However if you were to look into it, you would find out many more things that are not as easy to dismiss. Just because we don't understand something doesn't mean it can't or doesn't exist. Also you say there is no food for them, but they have been witnessed not by two or ten people but thousands, eating deer, hogs and other mammals, including dogs. There are clear pictures of them that cannot be proven hoaxes. You only need to look. You also say there are no bones, well how often do people find bear bones in the wild or elk bones or any other bones. Also if they are a type of hominid, who is to say they don't bury their dead. Also I think there is more to them but I wont go into that as I dont think you will be receptive to it. But it explains why they can't be captured on camera or very rarely. These beings are not merely animals. Also, do you really think that a person's first reaction to witnessing something that is often traumatic to them and fear inducing, are going to react by saying oh geez let me take out my phone and get this on camera. No, fight or flight kicks in, not the thought of taking a picture.

49.author: rationalcrank
49.body:
I'm not sure what your talking about when you keep bringing up planet of the apes. The "apes" in those movies all wore clothes. Have you seen the movie?They where supposed to be evolved to be more human. I guess a better comparison might be the apes from 2001. Now those were beautiful costumes. 

Now if you are talking about film your talking to the right guy. I was in the film industry in the art department for 10 years in the early 90s. I can tell you a little about production. It's easy to make a costume that looks good for a single shot. The talented comes from a costume that can endure 12 to 14 hours of shooting over 4 to 6 months. That's hard.

Now as to the condition of a particular costume after 30-40 years, you need to  understand what they are made of. These are traditionally made of slush mold latex with wig hair punched in. That kind of latex starts deteriating after a few years. It gets sticky and gummy and any wig hair that is around it starts falling out or clumping together. I was given one of the masks from a low budget film called Scarecrows that worked on. It was a cool mask but after a few years I had to throw it away because it was just a mess.

Anyway sorry to drone on. Realy my other points are better. Not enough food, no bones and less video even though there are video cameras in everyone's hands. There are even night cameras. We don't need  video, bones would be enough.

49.author: rationalcrank
49.body:
I would love to see a source for the claim that "thousands" have seen them eating dogs, deer, and hogs. I would like to see the clear modern pictures. maybe you can link to unbiased sources for that. 

as to not finding bones, I found deer bones last year while hiking but that's beside the point. there would be bones found by experts and DNA throughout these forests. Even if buried bones become exposed by animals and erosion.  There would even be an archeological branch found in the fossil record.

But besides the common reaction of fight or flight, there were pictures of bigfoot in the past when there were few cameras. Now that there are many many more cameras there should be many many more pictures, right?

49.author: Peaches-n-macaroons
49.body: Just because it's not made public, doesn't mean our government doesn't have them. Has that crossed your mind. I guess you fully trust them.

49.author: Peaches-n-macaroons
49.body: Look it up yourself, investigate. There is not one book that has the quote, even if there was it would still mean nothing to you. You are clearly asking in bad faith, so why even ask. Search Scott Peterson, read his book, David Paulides and the Hoopa Project, How to hunt.com and so many others. See if afterwards you think it's one huge hoax. It's up to you not me. I don't have to prove something that has proven itself and there are loads of evidence available to those who search. Sadly, I don't live with a book of sources, quotes or the like just to prove to people like you something. Even when I point you to sources, I am almost sure, you won't even look into it, so why ask?

49.body: Why does the goverment want to keep  bigfoots a secret? They don't keep other newly discovered creatures a secret.

49.author: rationalcrank

I just have close knowledge of it and a family member who is credible having had a horrific encounter. As well as other family members telling other stories that happened to them. They are not alone. There are millions. But a person like you will always dismiss that so yeah. Bye, have a nice day.

53.author: brian_heriot
brian_heriot
53.body:
Super-Galactic-Colossal hint about what you must *be* in order to be saved (according to Pantheopsychic as opposed to Fundamentalist Christianity):

1. In the comic cover above, the Christ figure is, as evidenced by the hint of thorns about his forehead, in the process of being crucified.
2. While crucified, He is dreaming.
3. What then, is the modern human image emerging from His forehead?

What the frightened human *is* and why He is emerging, so to speak, from the dreaming mind of Jesus while being crucified is the "letting the cat out of the bag early" answer to what any of us must BE in order to be written in the Book of Life (according to Pantheopsychic Theology).

JB

53.author: brian_heriot
53.body:
"This" is probably and arguably the most logical form of Christianity that shall and can ever exist.

JB

54.author: silentdrestrikesback
54.body:
Oh my God! Let me explain properly since you have a fucking time understanding!

You know what happens when you trim your nails? It grows back, with me so far? Now imagine if it grows in two places, One on the outer layer, where Dead cells would normally form and one within in, Just between where your Nail would normally grow and your fucking Finger!

Doesn't sound fun, right? It's not! It's uncomfortable as fuck! So now you have to trim that one as well! Hence the cuts everytime I fucking trim my finger, It only happens on my MIDDLE FUCKING FINGER, EVERY FUCKING TIME! 

But hey, I guess it's my dumbass fault that Biology designed my nail to grow that way, Hence why I asked "is this normal?" 

Could I have asked the question better? Yes! Definitely! Did some asshole have to call me Fucking mentally handicapped outta nowhere? Fucking No!

58.author: OneHumanPeOple
58.body: The plant itself grows like a vine.  I think it might do well although it needs a lot of light.  I grew them in a 5 gallon terracotta pot on my patio.  They’re originally from Mexico.  I live in a climate a lot like New York and they did very well here in Summer.  I’m not sure what your climate is like.  Maybe a bit of research would help [How to grow Mouse Melons](https://gardenerspath.com/plants/vegetables/grow-cucamelons/#:~:text=Mouse%20melons%2C%20cucamelons%2C%20or%20sour,commonly%20found%20in%20Central%20America)

58.author: SushiKittyCat

58.author: OneHumanPeOple
58.body: They have the same needs as cucumbers.  The vines are smaller.  You could grow them in a large flower pot and let them vine up some twigs.  That’s what I did.  The thing you’re missing in the UK is loads of sunlight.  But I think this year may be the year for that.

60.author: yeeeshwtf
60.body:
Its extremely true. Its rayon. Made in a chemical bath type of holy crap theres nothing "bamboo" about this anymore. If you heat it, it will melt like plastic

Gimme a bit and i can dig through my horde and post a pic of bast vs rayon bamboo. Night and day difference

60.author: Sgt_SaltySlug
60.body: Taken from google so I’m admittedly not an expert but here- “Rayon is a semi-synthetic fiber, made from natural sources of regenerated cellulose, such as wood and related agricultural products. It has the same molecular structure as cellulose. It is also called viscose. Many types and grades of viscose fibers and films exist.” I think you are confused as to what purely synthetic materials are. There is a difference from a chemistry standpoint.

60.author: Sgt_SaltySlug
60.body: Alternatively, something like Aerogel would be considered purely synthetic. Also, polyester since we’re talking about fabrics.. That is purely synthetic. Rayon however is semi-synthetic and there is a distinctive difference between the two terms. So no, not true to say bamboo textiles are purely synthetic.

60.author: yeeeshwtf
60.body:
You are right, i misspoke... but its absolutely more synthetic than not... cellulose is a molecular structure, just a straight chain polymer... one found in frigging EVERYTHING, theres really nothing special about the cellulose in bamboo (at least not from a fabric properties standpoint... like cotton vs linen has different qualities... but bamboo vs milk thistle is rayon vs rayon here)

To get bast fibers like linen from flax, we dry the source plant out, do a controlled rotting (called retting), manually break the stalks, scrape it and comb it to get all the bits of chaff leaving only the long supporting/nutrient carrying structures from the plant. 

Rayon, we crush it to a pulp and soak it in multiple chemical washes to seperate a single type of molicule and basically coerce them chemically to bond together.  So about as natural as "gelatin" is. 

Here's a bit of bast I've been trying to spin, its tricky because most of my work requires high twist but bast is fragile and breaks VERY easily... my spinning wheel cant go slow enough! The rayon (its dyed) is super easy to spin and behaves more like silk, very fine and very strong.

The rayon averages about 12micron width 

https://imgur.com/gallery/3LTv8wh

60.author: Sgt_SaltySlug
60.body: Agreed. Yea I completely understood the idea that the bamboo portion is complete marketing bs. It is more synthetic than not and the source of cellulose could be practically anything. I wasn’t trying to be pedantic just the distinction between semi and purely synthetic was bothersome haha. I’m glad you remained cordial though and shared that picture, something I would not expect to see ever really and it was interesting to learn more about it all. Thank ya!

60.author: yeeeshwtf
60.body: No you're actually correct... just ME being a bit irked by textile marketing gimmics. Idk how often ive yelled "its just friggin raaayoooon" at my tv. to the spinning community you dont see that distinction made really, just naturals vs synthetics, its easy to forget semisynthetic is a thing.

60.author: Sgt_SaltySlug
60.body: Now I’m curious as to what it is you make? Do you have an online store?

60.author: yeeeshwtf
60.body: No i only do commission work, mostly i do stuff as a hobby for me but i usually have at least one commission project going, i get most of my clients via fb but i have it good with my local yarn store owners as well. A LOT of knit shawls, mostly bridal... ive done one knit dress and never ever again! I'm currently building a high tension vertical loom to do Tibetan rug knotting (i must be insane). I teach all my crafts as well.

60.author: Sgt_SaltySlug
60.body: That’s so cool. I wish I had the patience and time to learn such a craft. Although, I have a million other hobbies I also don’t have time to perfect lol

60.author: yeeeshwtf
60.body: The severe untreated ADHD and crippling lack of social life helps 🤷‍♂️

60.author: Sgt_SaltySlug
60.body: 😂 i can relate. Although the kids keep me busy

60.author: yeeeshwtf
60.body: Ohhh that'll do it. Cats are enough to keep me busy... though kids would be easier to train around expensive fiber equipment... 🤔

60.author: Sgt_SaltySlug
60.body: After a certain age, yes! Haha

65.author: TheSourCrapple
65.body: No, probably not the best idea.

65.author: InevitableAd5222
65.body: Super doubt it would cause harm if he uses a modern browser/pdf viewer. An 0-day allowing RCE just from opening a file would be HUGE. I guess the risk is that the 0-day exists and is being utilized? Unless OP is being targeted by a nation state, this is probs just a spray and pray stratagem with a common exploit. Attacker is hoping hes using old software (like internet explorer on Win 8 type shit) that does have such vulnerabilities (reading the pdf executes code hidden within). Correct me if im wrong or you think im overlooking. I work in programming and dabble in pen testing but always trying to learn more especially something that would be this dangerous (RCE from a PDF viewed in browser).

65.author: TheSourCrapple
65.body: Honestly you are way more qualified than me to answer this I was just going off the classic rule “don’t open links, files, etc from random accounts/emails. But yeah if you think it should be fine to click into it than who am I to say :)

65.author: InevitableAd5222
65.body:
Ohhhh was just curious if you had a different experience. That is generally a really good rule though. I mean the public generally aren't using the newest software and there is always the chance some exploit is in the wild being utilized without reports yet.

That said **I would love if OP saw this** and could forward me the email. I could check if it was infected and if so maybe tell you what it was targeting. Or OP if you feel safe just download yourself (don't open) and upload it here: https://www.virustotal.com/gui/home/upload
